intro: Dichodon alborzensis, commonly known as the white-flowered dichodon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
